{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about sickle cell anemia. None of the provided documents mention sickle cell anemia, so we need to consider the types of genetic mutations that can cause such a condition. Sickle cell anemia is caused by a point mutation in the HBB gene that codes for hemoglobin beta. This mutation leads to abnormal hemoglobin production and characteristic sickling of red blood cells.", "answer_choice": C}
